hints: Provide the algorithm as pseudocode or a Lean function definition
State the loop invariant explicitly
Separate termination from partial correctness
Specify the domain and codomain precisely
State whether convergence is pointwise or uniform
Use Mathlib's Analysis and Topology namespaces
Define the filtration and probability space
State the no-arbitrage condition precisely
Specify discrete vs continuous time
Specify the field (real, complex, finite)
State dimensions explicitly
Use Mathlib's LinearAlgebra namespace
Be as precise and unambiguous as possible
Define all non-standard notation

translation_rules: Convert vague quantifiers ('for large n') into precise statements ('there exists N such that for all n >= N')
Replace informal notation with standard mathematical notation
Make implicit assumptions explicit (e.g., 'positive' -> 'strictly positive real number')
When the user says 'show' or 'demonstrate', convert to 'Prove that'
When the user references a well-known theorem by name, include the full statement
If the problem involves real numbers, specify the field explicitly
For probabilistic statements, specify the probability space
For algorithmic claims, separate the algorithm definition from the property to prove
